clinical_study.brief_title: The Role of Consolidative Autologous Stem Cell Transplantation After First-line Therapy in Peripheral T Cell Lymphoma
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Study of Consolidative Autologous Stem Cell Transplantation After First-line Therapy in Peripheral T Cell Lymphoma

brief_summary.textblock: The role of autologous stem cell transplantation (ASCT) in the first remission (CR1 & PR1) of peripheral T-cell lymphomas (PTCLs) is not well defined. This study analyzed the impact of ASCT on the clinical outcomes of patients with newly diagnosed PTCL in CR1 and PR1.

arm_group.description: patients who achieved CR or PR after 6-8 cycles first-line therapy receive ASCT as consolidation therapy
patients who achieved CR or PR after 6-8 cycles first-line therapy finish their therapy and go into follow-up

intervention.description: high dose chemotherapy followed by autologous stem cell transplantation

study_pop.textblock: lymphoma patients in several hospitals in China

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with confirmed pathological diagnosis of aggressive PTCL
- Age 18-65 years old
- Achieving CR or PR after first-line therapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subtypes with a more indolent course, including precursor T/natural killer neoplasms, T‐cell large granular lymphocytic leukemia, mycosis fungoides other than transformed mycosis fungoides, Sézary syndrome, and primary cutaneous CD30‐positive disorders.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Party secretary of Cancer Hospital of Peking University, Director of Internal Medicine
